discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
To enable multicast on the WLANs in the network when global multicast has been configured for multicast-multicast but is not functioning, the correct action is:

D. Enable WLAN advanced settings to support multicast-multicast mode.

Explanation:
WLAN Advanced Settings: Multicast-multicast mode requires enabling specific advanced settings on the WLAN to ensure that multicast traffic is properly forwarded. This setting ensures that multicast traffic is handled correctly across the WLANs.

C. Enable the Multicast VLAN feature: This is used for segregating multicast traffic into a specific VLAN but does not directly enable multicast functionality on the WLANs.

choices.D: Enable WLAN advanced settings to support multicast-multicast mode.
choices.B: Set the radio policy to All on the WLAN.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Global multicast has been configured for multicast-multicast, but multicast is not functioning on any of the WLANs in the network. Which action enables multicast?

An engineer configures QoS on an AireOS WLC v8.5. The engineer configures a WLAN for voice traffic and must give a higher priority to WMM clients than to non-WMM clients. Which two configurations should be performed? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Set Multicast Default Priority to Voice.
choices.C: Set Unicast Default Priority to Platinum.
choices.D: Select Video from the Unicast Default Priority drop-down menu.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
Platinum QoS Profile: This profile is used for voice traffic and provides the highest priority for WMM clients. It ensures that voice traffic from WMM clients is prioritized over other types of traffic.

Gold QoS Profile: This profile is used for video traffic and provides a high priority, but lower than Platinum. It ensures that non-WMM clients receive appropriate prioritization without interfering with the higher-priority WMM clients.

Why not the other options?

B. Set Multicast Default Priority to Voice: This is unrelated to prioritizing WMM clients over non-WMM clients.

C. Set Unicast Default Priority to Platinum: This would apply to all unicast traffic, not specifically to WMM clients.

D. Select Video from the Unicast Default Priority drop-down menu: This would prioritize video traffic, not voice traffic.

Selected Answer: D
NETCONF: This protocol is used for device discovery and configuration in Cisco DNA Center and SD-Access environments. If NETCONF is not enabled or properly configured on the WLC, it will not be discovered by Cisco DNA Center, even if firewall rules are the same for all controllers.

Why not the other options?

A. YANG: YANG is a data modeling language used with NETCONF but is not directly responsible for device discovery.

B. SNMP Management: SNMP is used for monitoring and managing devices but is not the primary protocol for discovery in SD-Access environments.

C. SNMP Trap: SNMP traps are used for event notifications and are not related to device discovery.

Selected Answer: B
For discovery, one set of CLI credentials and one set of SNMP credentials (SNMPv2c Read, SNMPv2cWrite, or SNMPv3) is mandatory.

If the discovery issue is related to the fabric-enabled WLAN controllers, Netconf (Network Configuration Protocol) could also play a role in the discovery process, especially if the controllers are managed through Netconf.

questions.question_text: During discovery, one out of five fabric-enabled WLAN controllers is not being properly discovered. The firewall rules are the same for all the controllers. Which element is missing?

choices.D: Install the software code for the WLC that supports the Hyperlocation module.
choices.C: Wait 60 to 90 minutes for RRM to settle before recording location measurements.
choices.A: Open SNMP port 161 and NMSP port 16113 on the WLC.
choices.B: Enable Hyperlocation in the Global Configuration settings of the WLC.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
RRM (Radio Resource Management): After enabling Hyperlocation, the system requires time to stabilize and optimize its operations. This includes RRM settling and the Hyperlocation module calibrating itself to the environment. Waiting 60–90 minutes allows the system to achieve accurate location measurements.

Selected Answer: C
Thanks to largestyle's source I made Deepseek change its answer

C. Wait 60 to 90 minutes for RRM to settle before recording location measurements.

Explanation:
RRM (Radio Resource Management): After enabling Hyperlocation, the system requires time to stabilize and optimize its operations. This includes RRM settling and the Hyperlocation module calibrating itself to the environment. Waiting 60–90 minutes allows the system to achieve accurate location measurements.

Why not the other options?

A. Open SNMP port 161 and NMSP port 16113 on the WLC: While these ports are necessary for communication, they are not the root cause of poor location accuracy in this scenario.

B. Enable Hyperlocation in the Global Configuration settings of the WLC: This is already implied in the scenario, as the WLAN is deployed with Hyperlocation enabled.

D. Install the software code for the WLC that supports the Hyperlocation module: AireOS v8.2 already supports Hyperlocation, so this is not necessary.

Selected Answer: C
Second this. From the URL above:
 Troubleshooting HyperLocation Deployment Issues

Hardware
 Poor location accuracy when packets arrive:
 Ensure NTP server is up and running.
 Ensure the same NTP server is used for syncing time for WLC, MSE and PI.
 Ensure that any tilt of APs is recorded accurately within PI maps.
 Ensure the accurate azimuth angle is recorded within PI.
 Allow 60-90 minutes for RRM to settle before recording location measurements.

Not according to the following (trouble shooting section) the answer is to wait 60-90 minshttps://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/technotes/8-2/b_hyperLocation_best_practices_and_troubleshooting_guide.html#id_12692

Selected Answer: D
The Cisco Hyperlocation modules require compatible software code on the WLC to fully support and optimize their functionality. Without the appropriate software code, the WLC may not be able to effectively process and utilize the capabilities of the Hyperlocation modules, potentially leading to poor location accuracy.

By installing the correct software code for the WLC that supports the Hyperlocation module, the engineer ensures that the WLC can properly integrate with and leverage the capabilities of the Hyperlocation modules. This should help improve location accuracy and overall performance when utilizing Hyperlocation features in the WLAN environment.

questions.question_text: An engineer configures an AireOS WLC v8.2 that has Cisco Aironet 3700 Series APs and Cisco Hyperlocation modules. The engineer deploys and enables a WLAN that has Hyperlocation. During testing, the engineer notices poor location accuracy when the packets arrive. Which action resolves the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
To troubleshoot client connectivity issues for a VoWiFi (Voice over Wi-Fi) network, an engineer should run the Traffic Stream Metrics report in Cisco Prime Infrastructure (PI). This report provides detailed information about the quality of service (QoS) for voice traffic, including metrics such as jitter, packet loss, and latency, which are critical for diagnosing VoWiFi issues.

Selected Answer: B
The Traffic Stream Metrics report in Cisco Prime Infrastructure provides detailed information about traffic streams, including metrics related to quality of service (QoS), packet loss, latency, and jitter. These metrics are crucial for evaluating the performance of real-time applications such as voice calls over Wi-Fi.

questions.question_text: Which Cisco Prime Infrastructure report does an engineer run to troubleshoot client connectivity issues for a VoWiFi network?
